page.title: 04Employment
page.content: Being a rural area there are not a wide variety of jobs available locally. In the town the main places of employment are on the Harlaw Industrial Estate. Here there are electrical engineering works, factories making parts to be used in the oil industry and a meat processing factory. In another part of town there is an abattoir which provides jobs for a few people. In our survey we found that only 30% of those questioned worked within a 5 mile radius of their home, 32% worked in Aberdeen, 17% worked offshore on oil rigs and the remainder were either retired , unemployed or worked on the land. 20% of those questioned had oil-related jobs. A large percentage of those who travel a distance to work said they would prefer to work locally if jobs were available.
